Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Absolutley fantastic hostel! Amazing location and great friendly staff. ............................................................................................. Highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “OK - for sleep only”
Reviews.Author: Kochen Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Basic ok and fine location. No luxury and a lot off noice from the street. Bed with a low standard. Related to the price the standard was as expected. The staff was friendly and met my expectations. Wifi works but at low speed.

Reviews.Title: “Average hostel”
Reviews.Author: afs216
Reviews.Content: Our rate was good, so for us Agua Alegre was an average 'you get what you paid for' deal. Our room was spacious, but only very basically furnished and NOT clean whatsoever. Uncomfortable and old beds. Location: Sagrada Familia is a 20-minute walk, Placa Catalunya is 12 minutes by foot. The neighbouring streets are full of tapas restaurants and pubs.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place to Stay even for one night”
Reviews.Author: GEGEKrakow
Reviews.Content: Horrible place to stay even for one night ... I booked 4 nights but after one night we canceled reservation - one night was VERY Expensive - 65 EURO!!!! Very dangerous elevator !!!! in the room is basically NOTHING !!!! Don't go there ... you can find any other better Hotel/Hostel in that location - from our room we had a view on staircase - we were unable to sleep because of noise and temperature - (only small & ventilator / fan) All in all DISASTER !!!! Very expensive Disaster....

Reviews.Title: “Not reccommended at all”
Reviews.Author: Ginte_Smilte
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hostel for 3 nights in a private double room. When I am looking for a hostel (NOT a hotel), I expect a lower price, a bed and a shower. We paid 172 Eur. for three nights, which would have been decent enough. However. The mattress was so bad I got bruises on my body from sticking springs. The shower was broken and we could not wash up normally - the water was running everywhere except for the shower head. The room was incredibly small (as opposed to what was shown in the pictures online), not overly clean either. On top of everything, I found it reasonable to ask for a discount for all the inconveniences during our checkout. However, the staff was unwilling to even consider my request, nor did they provide me with the contacts of the manager, finding an excuse that he is spending time with his family (instead of being available and responsible for what is happening at his hostel). I do not reccommend Aqua Alegre for those who want to get accommodation for the value of their money.

Reviews.Title: “Not helpful”
Reviews.Author: mcleanar
Reviews.Content: I booked this online. My plans changed so with months of warning I wanted to cancel and hoped a refund. I would of understood if they would take out an administrative fee. But no, they would not refund my money. I made it clear that I was still coming so they couldn't double dip and two payments for the room. Unhappy with service.

Reviews.Title: “Great situation, nice people but poor quality”
Reviews.Author: charlenegomezfr
Reviews.Content: They respected my wish to be on a upper floor to start. That was really helpful because this hotel can be really noisy. The guy at the reception desk could speak ENglish and fluent French. He was nice and friendly. The room was bright but the windows did not close properly. The bedding quality was OK. The good surpirse was the fridge and kitchnette for breakfast. The bathroom is ok, not dirty but very old. The good point is the terrasse where you can have a drink ( the reception sells bottles of wine and it is not expensive) and even enjoey your breakfast, there is always someone to talk with ! Oh and the elevator is a real experience ! Very old one, really nice ( typical from the 40s-50s) but can bear only 2 persons ( we tried 4 and we actually blocked it!!) Very good situation, quite calm during the weekend. We have already recommended this place to a friend, because the room rate is cheap for this city !

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: FabioV76
Reviews.Content: It is a no frills place, don't expect a 5 stars hotel, it's an 'Hostal'. it was clean as i expected. We had a big, essential room, personal was friendly and helpful, only we gave credit card number only as garancy, and they loaded the complete amouth for the four days -and gave me a receipt- without asking before. great sun terrace. I would reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Info by phone”
Reviews.Author: oldbar
Reviews.Content: I have contacted the hostal by phone from Australia. I wanted to bring a group of teenagers there. I can speak Catalan fluently, because I am actually from Barcelona. The person at the reception was totally unhelpful and rude. I will not make a booking there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: leroy186
Reviews.Content: Great location in the city center, all sightseeings nearby. We take a room with shared bathroom and was very clean and cosy. Staff was helpful and english spoken. They dont clean the rooms every day but everything else was OK for the price we paid (50 Euros per night). I will bask again for sure

Reviews.Title: “bad, bad, bad”
Reviews.Author: Mauro_Riccio
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a hostel. it's really dirty. the rooms are old. the price isn't as good as could seems.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Location, Friendly Staff, Limited Services.”
Reviews.Author: MelbTrav
Reviews.Content: You really do feel like you are in Spain in this hotel. The colour schemes, the shared lounge on every level and the view into the courtyards behind the hotel really make it different to your normal hotel. There are limited services, no laundry, no room service, complicated after hours contact with staff. There is a luggage room, a nice foyer, a nice little courtyard and the staff are quite friendly, willing to go out of their way to help and they all speak English. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Agua Alegre”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferocious
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be very charming, never really saw anyone (staff or other guests) so it felt really peaceful. Unlike in some other reviews, we found the bed really comfortable, however we had done a lot of walking everyday and would have probably found the marble floor comfy. And I agree that you definitely know you are in Spain. We only paid £35 a night for a double with a shared bathroom which was clean and the shower was good. Location is excellent and only a 5 minute walk to La Ramblas. Barcelona tip: don’t bother with the open top Barcelona tour bus, a day pass for the tube is much cheaper (about €5), quieter and you don’t feel rushed to move on constantly, the Sagrada Familia alone takes up 2/3 hours of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: ibizaking99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Agua Alegre for 10 nights in May and it was fantastic- The employess, the location, the service, breakfast and cleanness of the hotel were all great. Highly recommeneded and we will go back in Spring for another visit to this great hotel. Make sure you aslo saty in this hotel when in Barcelona and it is a guarantee that you will be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “I knew I was in Spain”
Reviews.Author: dancing-heart1
Reviews.Content: Sweet staff all the time, very helpful and thoughtful (saw it was my birthday and provided a little bottle of sparkle). Room very basic but clean and overlooking very nice Spanish terrace for breakfasting etc. I knew I was in Spain; you don't when you are in the Hilton etc. Altogther I felt very safe and at home (also great location 3 mins from Casa Batlla with supermarket and cafes on block). Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: oceanomad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the agua alegre hotel/hostel on the last night of a trip to the infamous benicassim festival. The hotel was clean, although very basic, room was a good size with a view over a large courtyard and view across the terraces of a number of different buildings within the city. We paid €60 for two of us for one night and booked only a week in advance which i thought was rather reasonable, especially around this time of the year when Barcelona is awash with travelers, and booked through http://www.laterooms.com Our accomodation: Our accommodation comprised of a double room, with a comfortable double bed, two chairs and a table, a large window, ceiling fan, adequate lighting and cupboards. The hotel also provided us with two towels each and an extremely detailed map of the city! The bathroom facilities for the room we stayed in was shared but was very clean and relatively new. Finding the Hostel & Access: The hotel/hostel was relatively easy to find but only if you know the EXACT address!!! So when visiting bear this in mind, you will need to look for the building number.. 47 i believe. The front of the hotel looks like the entrance to a block of flats, and there is no obvious sign to show its location on the street! Reception is up a flight of stairs and for any luggage that cannot be carried up the stairs there is a very small cage type lift that can be used to access most floors. For this reason i must say that disabled customers or people with large amounts of luggage may have some difficulty accessing this accommodation. Facilities nearby: On the same road as the hostel/hotel there is a supermarket and a mercedona can be found a few roads away. Also opposite is a lovely small bar/restaurant called the moviebar that plays old films, serves cocktails and great popular food with a Japanese twist! The closest METRO station is GIRONA and this is only a two blocks away, about a 3min walk. Conclusion: Overall we were pleased with our stay, the guy at reception although claimed to have been his first day working there was very helpful and i would definitely consider returning in the future. The location is pretty central and easy to get to by tube, this area of Barcelona felt much less threatening than other areas at night and my girlfriend and i felt it much safer than hostels and areas around such places as Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect -- convenient, clean, sweet, cheap”
Reviews.Author: bearfeet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days over New Years. Our room was very clean and cute (though sparse). The staff was sweet and tried to be helpful though sometimes it was hard to make our desires understood. We did have a problem with our hot water, which was fixed immediately upon notifying the staff. I really think the location is excellent. It is in a residential area only two blocks off a major shopping district. Super convenient by subway as a jumping off point. I would definitely stay here again. This is not a luxury hotel by any means but for what it is, budget travel in a major city--I was extremely pleased by the level of service and size of room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: QueenStGuy
Reviews.Content: The Agua Alegre was a great low-budget option. My room (#19) was clean, large and airy, as was the private bath. The rooms are basic: no TV, no phone, no A/C (they do have ceiling fans). The lack of A/C means your windows are open on warm days. Barcelona can be a noisy city, so if you're a light sleeper, ear plugs may be helpful. Although after using them the 1st night, I didn't bother afterwards, and had no issues with noise. Not all rooms have a private bath; those without use the shared facilities on each floor (which were spotless and well-appointed). The bed was adequate; a little squeaky, but not uncomfortable. The sheets were getting a little thin, but they were clean, as were the towels that were provided. The terrace is a nice place to sit and have a drink (note - bring your own; the hotel supplies only coffee, tea or bottled water), to have breakfast or just to read. The front-desk staff were very helpful and friendly. The location in the Eixample is excellent. There's an entrance to the Passeig de Gracia RENFE station one block north, which is convenient when coming from or going to the airport, or connecting to Sants station for longer train journeys. There are also several metro stops nearby, You're a two minute walk to the Passeig de Gracia; 5-8 minutes to Placa de Catalunya and the top of La Rambla, 8 minutes from the Palau de Music Catalan and the old town, etc. If you go, you'll find the place isn't well-signed. Look for the street number; at the entrance, just to the side of the door is a small card indicating that you've found the right spot. Go up the elevator to the next floor; that's where reception is. The hotel markets to gay and lesbian travellers, but when I was there, there was a mix of both gay clientele as well as straight couples, mothers and daughters travelling together, even a businessman or two. For a city where a hotel stay of just a few nights can put you in the poor-house, the Agua Alegre was a great option for me.

HotelInfo.Name: Agua Alegre
HotelInfo.Address: c/ Roger de Lluria, 47, 08009 Barcelona, Spain
